WaveSoundBuffer.PhaseVocoder.pitch

Function/Meaning
Frequency axis scale
Type
WaveSoundBuffer.PhaseVocoder class property (read/write)
Description
Represents the scale along the frequency axis. You can also set the value.
The value must be greater than 0.0.
Specifying 1.0 does not change the frequency axis scale (the pitch remains unchanged).
For example, specifying 1.0594630943593 raises the pitch by one semitone.
For example, specifying 0.9438743126817 lowers the pitch by one semitone.
Even if both the time and pitch properties are 1, the Phase Vocoder filter still operates, which slightly degrades sound quality and consumes CPU time. If you intend to keep both at 1, it is better to remove this filter from the filter array.
Changes to this property are reflected in real-time, but due to buffering, it takes about 2 seconds before the change is actually heard in playback.
